laboratory_examinations.findings: Slight, verrucous, epidermal hyperplasia with mild hyperkeratosis, hypergranulosis, and necrotic keratinocytes. Inflammatory infiltration at the dermoepidermal junction, composed mainly of lymphocytes with scattered eosinophils.
Normal male chromosome complement (46,XY); 30 cells were analyzed.
185 (92.5%) cells with signals for one X chromosome and one Y chromosome, and 13 (6.5%) with signals for two X chromosomes and one Y chromosome, indicating low-level XXY mosaicism.
No mutations identified in the NEMO gene.
